name: Tuna Mushroom Casserole
author: AMETHYST
summary: This is a wonderful, quick, and tasty supper that is always a hit when we serve it. You can always prepare the casserole the night before, pop it into the refrigerator, and cook it the next day. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain
In a mixing bowl, combine mushroom soup, milk, salt, and pepper
Then add tuna, mushrooms, and pasta
Pour mixture into the greased casserole dish
In another mixing bowl, combine bread crumbs, butter, and thyme
Sprinkle over the top of the tuna mixture
Bake uncovered in a preheated oven until bubbling and golden brown, about 40 minutes
